On previous visits I have had the mustard Pork Chop (which I can also recommend) and the Cheese burger (which isn't as good as others in the area. Add a couple of glasses of Syrah and it was a very pleasant dinner.  The service was good (attentive but not intrusive or rushed) and while not cheap at $100 for 2, it's not the priciest by a good big margin, and well worth it! I think of Tarbells when I want something that's comfortable but upscale and a little bit different (not just another steak or grilled Chilean Sea Bass with some kind of glaze). Mark Tarbell has thought this place out pretty well, and it's a very appealing spot.

This has been my favorite restaurant for the last ten years - I've had many dinners and even a few special events there.  Mark Tarbell is a great guy and he often hangs around the restaurant on weekends (and keeps the staff on their toes!).  If I had to pick the best items on the menu, I would recommend the Beef Carpaccio and the Spaghetti and Meatballs.

I have to say I would have given a 4 to 5 star rating particularly for the food, but our server was quite poor and it was clear he was struggling with multiple tables etc. My wife and I are from NY and know good food and this place has it. We came to the restaurant with our young autistic son who is very high functioning and is a hamburger nut. It was clear he frustrated the waiter even more! We had to wait for a drink quite a while so I got up to go to the bar to order. I wasn't upset as I recognized our waiter was dealing with an order issue at another table that was clearly not his doing. Nonetheless, it clearly set his mood off.  As for the food, I had the peppercorn steak and for appetizer the octopus. My wife had soft shell crabs and as an appetizer the beef carpaccio. The food across the board was amazing and cooked to perfection.  My wife and I said we would definitely come back but sit in a different section of the restaurant.   My wife and son came back into town yesterday so I booked a dinner here again tonight because we liked the food so much and we wanted to give it another try on the service. . Tonight was spectacular in every way from the manager coming up to the table to thank us us for coming again to the waiter and of course the food. Best restaurant in the area, and i changed my rating to 5 stars.

I had a great birthday dinner at Tarbell's yesterday evening. It was a quaint restaurant with SUPERB service. The hostesses were very friendly and seated us promptly when we walked in (although we did make reservations ahead of time). The server was very genuine and attentive. She knew the menu and offered to split my guests meal in half because he could not choose on just one entree. Talk about service!  I ordered the special halibut (Mr. Catch of the Day) and it was exactly how it was described.   Although I would not recommend taking many children to Tarbell's, we did take our 10 mo old son and the wait staff was very gracious to him. They even thanked us for feeling comfortable enough for bringing the entire family to dine with them.  GREAT EXPERIENCE. I will return!

Fresh menu, fresh ingredients, great service. Not much more to say on this one. The visible pizza oven was temping but on a visit for dinner I went for the fish special of the day which was a freshly caught swordfish and was not disappointed. The side bonus (which did not really apply to my menu selection for the night) was also seeing they are open to changing menu items to be gluten free as well. What? Recipes on their website too? Not sure when, if ever, I have seen that before.  Before coming here comments from others set the bar pretty high and I would say there was nothing to disappoint that expectation level on my first visit.

My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary, and it was very good. The ambience was a little old school, but the food was great. We split a light salad to start and the waiter had them split it onto two plates for us, which was really nice. The salad was flavorful, but not overpowering. I had scotch beef for my main and he had BBQ pork. They were both delicious! I could have licked the bowls. Finally for dessert we had this amazing cheesecake with rosemary caramel sauce. It was so rich and wonderful. This place is a bit pricey, but it is so worth it.

I came here for what should've been a nice meal at the bar. I've never heard of a bar taking reservations. I've heard of reservations for tables but not a seat at the bar. The most idiotic thing I've ever heard in the restaurant business. Mark you should rethink position on somebody coming in wanting a cold refreshment and a meal and being able to have a open seat at the bar.

Food is excellent. I had the ribbon pasta with a spicy fennel chicken sausage.  Party of 6, and whether it was fish, steak, or pasta, superior plate presentation, food quality, taste, and temp. Outstanding meal. Terrific wines.  A big however, the ventilation of the kitchen is poor. Throughout the evening, the smelly smoke from the kitchen flowed into the whole restaurant, which clung onto our clothing after departure. In addition, the waiter service was excellent and formal, however initial time to take our order was 10 mins.

Tarbell's is at the top of the food chain here in Phoenix. In the dozens and dozens of times I have been here I have never been, nor have my guests ever been, let down.  The drinks are outstanding, the wine list well thought out, the menu a perfect mix that makes you think "gee I wish I could have the Scotch Beef (best item on the menu) and Mark's Famous Spaghetti and Meatballs." Great News you can!  I will have a half order of this and a half order of that, and they say "no problem!"  Anyway, Mark Tarbell has created a special place that all should enjoy at least once; but I recommend not limiting yourself to just once.  Call for reservations, but keep in mind that the bar is a great place to have your meal as well...

Bah.  I expected so much more.  Noca (one of my top 3 in AZ) is less than a mile away and I expected Tarbell's to be at least near the level of quality.  Now, I must say, the service was 5 stars (great server and charming Mr. Tarbell came by and chatted with us) However, the quality of what was on our table just simply wasn't there.    Two people in our party of three ordered off the restaurant week menu.  The fresh mozzarella appetizer was described as "delicious, but lacking pesto".  I ordered the Grilled Organic Salmon on Crispy Potato Cake molasses, lime, McClendon's honey.  The salmon was cooked to perfection and I thoroughly enjoyed the tangy glaze.  But OMG!!-- the crispy potato cake confused the hell out of me-- it tasted like burnt shoestring potato pieces.  Seriously. I expected crisp fritter or hash...something edible and not over-deep-fried.  Onto dessert.....I opted out, but the other 2 were given dessert with the restaurant week deal.  The mousse was terrific! (props to that) The doughnut holes were a letdown.  Like my potatoes, they where very overcooked.  In fact, one was ridiculously dark brown-- visibly over-fried.  We were kind of surprised it was even brought to our table like that.  For the price that we paid for average food, I really wished we would have gone across the street to Noca :(  Highlights:  service, atmosphere, mozzarella, mousse

We're Brazilian. Well, my wife and her friends are (I've lived there for a decade) so we were amused to see Mark was doing a Sunday offering "coxinhas" - a brazilian "street food" thing that's difficult to fake. Simply amazing. I hope he does it again - best coxinhas we've ever had - including Rio de Janeiro.

First comment is we went in for a late dinner stayed beyond their closing time never a push a rush to leave. I really do not have one complaint the food was stellar The fish was excellent flaky delicious wine the waiter suggested was excellent everything was wonderful. Lastly I will comment about the staff everyone we met or encountered was pleasant!

Incredibly pleasant surprise finding this gem owned by a chef who was on Iron Chef.  The menu was a great balance between seafood I love and non-seafood which my wife loves.  I initially chose this restaurant just for the grilled Caesar which was better than I thought it could be.  When our waiter Keith offered to give me a half portion of the lobster gnocchi and a 1/2 portion of the squid ink pasta instead of making me choose, I fell in love with the place.  Only thing better than that service was the taste of those two dishes which were INCREDIBLE!!!  Oh, the molten chocolate cake we had with salted caramel sauce topped this dinner off in a way I couldn't imagine.  Go have a great dinner at Tarbell's!
This place is 5 stars.  a pillar of Phoenix eating

Very good food. Had the pasta with bolognese sauce; very tasty. Bread pudding was divine. Service fair to partly cloudy. Table space is a bit tight. And, jaysus, does anyone put on decent garb to go out to dine anymore?  "Let's see: just finished mowing the lawn. Shit, shower and shave? Nah, blow it off honey, I'll go with what I got on..."  MadMen on AMC should be required viewing where men actually put on a necktie when going to someone else's home for dinner. Not that a tie is mandatory, but put on a collared shirt and a jacket in the winter time. Might actually lead an onlooker to believe you're doing well...hell, you'll believe it yourself after a while; funny how that works.

I can't believe I've never been here so I finally made a point to go!  Ambiance is great. I was on a date but I could have just have easily had a dinner with anyone here and it would have been perfect. The menu is not elaborate but very creative. My friend ordered the pasta and they offered to split two dishes for him so he could sample both. Great wine list. Not the best I've seen but you can definitely find a nice bottle.  Mark up is going to be ridiculous of course so find one you like and then get it at AJs or Total Wine.  The service was prompt and friendly. The table next to us was doing Grande Marnier flight which was different.  Dessert which we never skip was delicious! We had the mousse. I had the Scotch beef.  It was so tender and flavorful,  it just pulled apart on my fork. We also tried the pizza as an appetizer.  So good!  It was dim and quiet.  Some music played and there were plenty of servers.  Overall very nice place. Prices are a tad high comparatively.  Filet was about $49. But if it's a special occasion or, you're not paying,  definitely recommend! !

Another amazing meal accompanied by amazing service! We started with sharing the caprese salad and beet salad, both very good. The homemade burrata was very creamy on very fresh plum tomatoes with a light pesto sauce. The beet salad with arugula was even better. The sweetest beets with fresh crisp arugula and creamy goat cheese with a very light dressing both were so large I was able to take some of the beet salad home to enjoy. For our entrees my husband had the NY strip; very tender, cooked perfectly medium rare delicious with a Cabernet reduction. He loved the accompanying  sides of creamed spinach and freshly cut, crispy pommes frites. I tried both and they were very good. The spinach wasn't overly creamed like some, just very light and perfectly seasoned. I had the gnocchi with lobster which had spinach and tomatoes in a light Parmesan cream sauce. It had several large pieces of lobster. Some pieces were large enough to cut with a knife and the lightest tender gnocci. We also had some additional sides, peas with multi-colored carrots all fresh and cooked perfectly still had some crispness and my favorite the tempura cauliflower, so crispy and delicious. I don't think I want to eat cauliflower any other way! For dessert we shared the cheesecake and it is wonderful! Light and airy but still very creamy and cheesy. Everything is large portions so we had plenty of take home boxes which made the next very special. Our waiter Allen was personable and really payed attention to all of requests taking notes along the way. He was attentive without be over-bearing. The perfect dinner. We will be back.

This is a lovely little restaurant. It is on a busy corner with a small parking lot but once you are inside the ambiance is charming. There is an intimate dining area and a bar area so you can choose what you are in the mood for.  We were greeted and seated immediately in the dining area.  Our server, Audrey,  was fantastic. I noticed they have a nice wine selection, although I did not have a glass. They offer poutine and we could not turn down the temptation, so we had to start with that.  It was delicious! I wasn't thrilled when I saw how skinny the fries were but the taste was excellent. The menu offers an inviting selection of items and they offer daily specials.  We chose the salmon and the chicken.  The salmon had a sweet sauce which I liked and it was served on a bed of lettuce. The chicken was done perfectly and came with a side of creamy mashed potatoes that will make you want to have them every day.  Refills on waters were prompt and plates were cleared right away. My only regrets are not trying the scotch beef and not being hungry enough for what looked like some fabulous desserts. Guess we have to go back.

My husband and I went in celebration of his recent promotion! Food was phenomenal as was the customer service! We will definitely be returning and recommending to others. Just a tip...BEST cheesecake we've ever had!!
